comments.creator: mitch.knudsen@live.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.1.17) Gecko/20110123 SeaMonkey/2.0.12

I have tried reinstalling SeaMonkey 2.0.12 and it still does not show up in Prog. & Feat.  I talked to Callek in the chat room and he told me to submit a bug report. He also told me to cc him at Callek@gmail.com but I dont see a field for that.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install SeaMonkey
2. Go to Programs & Features
3.
Actual Results:  
SeaMonkey does not show up

Expected Results:  
Showed up in Programs & Features so I can uninstall it.

comments.author: mitch.knudsen@live.com

comments.creator: erpman1@aim.com
comments.raw_text:
try downloading the Seamonkey setup file again from the Seamonkey web site:
http://www.seamonkey-project.org/

then run setup to re-install Seamonkey again to see if it will show up in the Programs and Features section.  also, try restarting the computer and then running Seamonkey setup again.

also, check if the helper.exe file is installed in the \Program Files\Seamonkey\uninstall\ folder.  you can run the helper.exe file to uninstall Seamonkey in case you are unable to uninstall Seamonkey from the Programs and Features section of Windows.
comments.text:

comments.raw_text: This did not work. I tired to install it again, and it did not show up in Programs and Features. I typed "\ProgramFiles\Seamonkey\uninstall\" and nothing showed up. I dont know how to access helper.exe, or even how to use it.

comments.author: wicked@sci.fi
comments.creator: wicked@sci.fi
comments.raw_text:
SeaMonkey doesn't add itself to "Programs & Features" for me either. (Trunk right now but I had same problem with 2.4 when it was still beta.) This might be due to using a non-admin account and unfortunately SM doesn't seem to UAC-elevate itself during install (which it could and should do).

I did manage to uninstall one copy of SM by simply running the helper.exe on the correct folder so this is probably only about not writing the necessary registry entries.
comments.text:
SeaMonkey doesn't add itself to "Programs & Features" for me either. (Trunk right now but I had same problem with 2.4 when it was still beta.) This might be due to using a non-admin account and unfortunately SM doesn't seem to UAC-elevate itself during install (which it could and should do).

I did manage to uninstall one copy of SM by simply running the helper.exe on the correct folder so this is probably only about not writing the necessary registry entries.
